prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story: My observation is there exists unequal share of State monies with its residents, before all the Urban residents get defensive please hear me out. Presently no one except Corporations pay State income taxes. No individual pays state taxes. I noticed state funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct Docks, powerful politicians pet projects such as office buildings, state troopers etc, etc. all these fundings and more are not necessary within City limits, I was amazed at how much our state provides city functions in the bigger cities thus growing the state budget, I saw on tv last night how adg&g was showing the little ones how to ice fish, couldn't the parents do that? yes I pay property taxes. But I will guarantee you once our City folk get the full bill with out the State monies we will not be as wasteful, on the office building...rent what space you need and help the office rental marked. In my business I just retired from,I would ask my managers, "how do you stop spending money"?
stories: My observation is that there is an unequal distribution of State funds among its residents. This observation is not meant to be defensive, but rather to provide a different perspective. Currently, only corporations pay State income taxes, while individuals do not pay any. I have noticed that State funds are used for various projects such as bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct docks, powerful politicians' pet projects like office buildings, and state troopers. However, these projects are not necessary within city limits, and they contribute to the growing State budget. I saw on TV last night how adg&g was teaching children how to ice fish, but couldn't their parents have done that? Yes, I pay property taxes, but if our City residents had to pay the full bill without State funds, we would be more careful with our spending. For example, instead of building an office building, we could rent the space we need and help the office rental market. In my business, I would often ask my managers how they would stop spending money.

I've noticed that there is a discrepancy in the way that State funds are distributed to its citizens. I'm not trying to be defensive, but rather offer a different viewpoint. At present, only corporations are required to pay State income taxes, while individuals are exempt. I've observed that State funds are being used for various projects, such as bike paths, road maintenance, defunct docks, pet projects of powerful politicians like office buildings, and state troopers. However, these projects are not essential within city limits and are contributing to the increasing State budget. Last night on TV, I saw that adg&g was teaching children how to ice fish, but couldn't their parents have done that? Yes, I do pay property taxes, but if our City residents were responsible for paying the full bill without State funds, we would be more cautious with our spending. For example, instead of constructing an office building, we could rent the space we need and help the office rental market. In my business, I would frequently ask my managers how they would cut costs.

State troopers are also funded. These projects may be beneficial outside the city limits, but contribute to the growing state budget. Last night I saw adg&g teaching children how to fish on ice on TV. But couldn't their parents have taught them that? Property taxes are paid, but if city residents had to cover all costs without state funding, we would be more careful with our spending. For example, instead of building an office building, we could rent the space we need and support the office rental market. In my business, I often asked my managers how they could reduce costs.
